Class.name: ZEN.Report.FOWrapper
Class.Description:
This ZEN Report class is a wrapper for any XSL-FO files, from which you want to generate a PDF file using the ZEN Report framework and especially the HotJVM Render Server feature, which is at the moment not available for direct XSL-FO -> PDF genearation out-of-the-box.

This adds a few extra lines to the beginning and the end of your XSL-FO file to make it usable with this class:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xsl:stylesheet version="1.0" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform">
<xsl:template match="/">
<fo:root xmlns:fo="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Format" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" xmlns:zr="http://www.intersystems.com/zenreports" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:svg="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <!-- XSL-FO content -->
</fo:root>
</xsl:template>
</xsl:stylesheet>

The report can be started either via HTTP request (from a browser) or from the background, using the GenerateReport() or the AsynchGenerateReport() method!

Parameter.name: DEFAULTMODE
Parameter.Description: Specifies the default display mode used for this report if the URL parameter, <var>$MODE</var>, is not present.

Parameter.name: DEFAULTCALLBACKCLASS
Parameter.Description: Default value for the <property>CallbackClass</property> property. This can be set in subclasses!

Parameter.name: DEFAULTCALLBACKMETHOD
Parameter.Description: Default value for the <property>CallbackMethod</property> property. This can be set in subclasses!

Property.name: FOFilename
Property.Description:
This is the full server-side path of the XSL-FO file. If it's not empty, the referenced file must exists in the server's filesystem, in a location, where the CachÃ© user can open and read it!

If the CallbackClass and the CallbackMethod are not empty and referring a valid class and method name, then this is ignored.

Property.name: CallbackClass
Property.Description: If this and the <property>CallbackMethod</property> are not empty and referring a valid class and method name, then the return value of the corresponding classmethod (which should be a character stream) is used as the XSL-FO file.

Property.name: CallbackMethod
Property.Description: If this and the <property>CallbackClass</property> are not empty and referring a valid class and method name, then the return value of the corresponding classmethod (which should be a character stream) is used as the XSL-FO file.

Method.name: %OnBeforeReport
Method.Description: This callback is invoked after this report is instantiated and before it is run.

XData.name: ReportDefinition
XData.Description: This report has a "fake" XML definition. Basically any XML would do, because the XSL-FO file is created outside of the ZEN Report class.
XData.Data: <report xmlns="http://www.intersystems.com/zen/report/definition" name="FO2PDFReport" call="FakeXML"> <!-- add definition of the report here. --> </report>

Method.name: FakeXML
Method.Description: Method, which generates the "fake" XML content of the report. At the moment this contains a single element (<fofile>), which reflects the parameters of the report.'

Method.name: TestFO2PDFFromFile
Method.Description:
This method can be used to test background generation of the PDF from an XSL-FO file.

pOutputFile is the (server-side) full path of the expected output file (PDF).
pFoFilename is the (server-side) full path of the XSL-FO input file.
pDisplayLog is 0 by default, if it's set to 1, the output file will contain the output of the FOP log instead of the PDF.
pRenderServer is empty by default. If a HotJVM Render Server is used to boost the performance of the PDF generation, then this argument has to contain the port number of the configured render server. For deatailed documentation see the HotJVM Render Server documentation!
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = $$$OK
Set report = ..%New() Set report.FOFilename = pFoFilename
Set tSC = report.GenerateReport(pOutputFile, 2, pDisplayLog, pRenderServer) Quit tSC

Method.name: TestFO2PDFFromMethod
Method.Description:
This method can be used to test background generation of the PDF from a callback method.

pOutputFile is the (server-side) full path of the expected output file (PDF).
pFoFilename is the (server-side) full path of the XSL-FO input file.
pDisplayLog is 0 by default, if it's set to 1, the output file will contain the output of the FOP log instead of the PDF.
pRenderServer is empty by default. If a HotJVM Render Server is used to boost the performance of the PDF generation, then this argument has to contain the port number of the configured render server. For deatailed documentation see the HotJVM Render Server documentation!
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = $$$OK
Set report = ..%New() Set report.CallbackClass = ..%ClassName(1) Set report.CallbackMethod = "FO2PDFCallback"
Set tSC = report.GenerateReport(pOutputFile, 2, pDisplayLog, pRenderServer) Quit tSC

Method.name: FO2PDFCallback
Method.Description: Sample callback method used by the <property>TestFO2PDFFromMethod</property> method.

Method.name: TransformFO2XSL
Method.Description: Appends the XSLT frame around the original XSL-FO stream, to make it usable with this report class.
Method.Implementation:
Set tSC = $$$OK
Set xslStream = ##class(%Stream.TmpCharacter).%New()
Do pFOStream.Rewind() Set first100 = pFOStream.Read(100) If $Extract(first100, 1, 2) = "<?" { Set xmlHeader = $Piece(first100, ">", 1) _ ">" Set first100 = $Piece(first100, ">", 2, *) } Else { Set xmlHeader = "" }
Do xslStream.WriteLine($Select( xmlHeader '= "": xmlHeader, 1: "<?xml version=""1.0"" encoding=""utf-8""?>")) Do xslStream.WriteLine("<xsl:stylesheet version=""1.0"" xmlns:xsl=""http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"">") Do xslStream.WriteLine("<xsl:template match=""/"">") Do xslStream.Write(first100) While 'pFOStream.AtEnd { Do xslStream.Write(pFOStream.Read(32000)) } Do xslStream.WriteLine("</xsl:template>") Do xslStream.WriteLine("</xsl:stylesheet>")
Quit xslStream
